Microphone works well.I am knocking one-star off because of the just "OK" WiFi range.Overall, I am very happy with the camera.Here's a short night video of the night-vision in action (3rd party CCTV software and FPS lowered due to night-vision).UPDATE: October 2012The camera has run flawlessly for 3 years. Today when cleaning the cam, I realized I needed a small replacement part and contacted the manufacturer. Guess what - he got back to me in less than 10 mins on a Sunday night and hes sending the part for free. Simply amazing support! I changed my review from 4 to 5 stars. Sharx cant be beat.

Reviews.Title: Not in this price range
Reviews.Author: SMXSteve
Reviews.Content: First, I am amused when I see reviews that get the highest rating yet it is the only item they have ever reviewed. Who is marking these reviews as helpful? They are obviously biased reviews. This is a good camera but there are better in this price range.I own a Panasonic Network Camera BL-C131A. I have had it for just short of a year but it has worked flawlessly. I thought the Panasonic was too expensive until I got this Sharx. My review is based on a comparison with my Panasonic since they are in similar price range (actually the Sharx is more expensive).These are both indoor cams. I use mine to look outside through a window.MotionThe Panasonic has full tilt and swivel which is fantastic. I have it mounted on the front porch and can view from my driveway on the East and  swivel over to the mailbox on the West.The Sharx is stationary.Build/DesignThe Panasonic is light gray and has a rounded/hi-tech look. It came with a bolt but no bracket. It has a short/stubby antenna.The Sharx is black and square and, to me, is less noticeable as a security cam except the antenna is about 4 inches long - all online pictures show it as a stub. It comes with an excellent bracket and bolt that mounts similar to a camera mount. I prefer the design of the Sharx.Setup/installationBoth are relatively easy to set up for someone who works with networking.Cam qualityIn the daytime they are both good for about 50 feet. You may not recognize the face but you can definitely see people, cars, animals.The Panasonic does well both day and night (with lighting of course). It is only in color so depending on your lighting will depend on what you actually see at night. But it also has adjustments for brightness and white balance. The color is better on the Panasonic even on cloudy/rainy days. It also looks like a live cam.The Sharx does a little better job at night with its "moonlight" option but it is also black and white. The live cam actually jumps, like it skips frames. Birds and squirrels always look like they are hopping across the yard. Color is also lacking, all the greens look purple. I tried several adjustments but nothing changed.SoundSound quality is good on both, that is the sound inside the house. Which is good because when I am away I can check the cam and look outside but I can listen inside.User InterfaceThe built in Panasonic user interface is well thought out and looks like they put a lot of effort into creating it. One nice feature is an error log showing the last 20 errors. For me it has been FTP issues which is awesome because I know if there is a problem or not.The Sharx is one of those companies that doesn't get it - software makes great hardware, without good software the hardware isn't any good at all. The Sharx interface is just plain uggggly. No error log. It took a long time to figure out if the FTP was working or not. I will give them credit for one thing, they made the settings open up to a separate page so you can make changes yet still view the image.WiFiI have had the Panasonic for several months with no issues connecting to it. While I haven't had the Sharx that long it also seems to keep a pretty constant connection.FeaturesThey both have the ability to save images and video periodically or based on motion. I haven't had the Sharx long enough but the Panasonic has done a great job. Besides motion detection, the Panasonic also has a sensor that detects heat. But since mine looks out a window the sensor doesn't work well if at all.You can adjust Panasonic color, brightness, etc. Not the Sharx.They both have zoom which is nothing more than zooming in on the image - the camera itself doesn't actually zoom so the image gets fuzzy.They both have the capability to FTP images, send email, and be setup on a web page.ManualPanasonic comes with a CD which installs a PDF manual. Or you can view it on their website.The Sharx comes with your standard paper manual but with colored text and images - the one thing they seemed to put extra effort into but it may be a bit too explanatory. If you are an advanced user you might get a little frustrated finding what you need. Beginners might find it overwhelming. I will give them credit though, it looks good.SupportPanasonic is superior. In fact, they have a great website that not only offers tips and FAQs but examples on how to code your own controls on your website. They also have excellent phone support on the installation and use of the cam.Sharx - zero support period. In fact, there is very little sales information and no technical information. For support you have to fill out an online form. Haven't tried it so I don't know if it works or how well. The only place I could find that this was an indoor cam was Indoor Only was marked on the box. Not in the manual nor on their website - not even the Amazon description.Night Vision?Both cams are for indoors only but the Sharx comes with night vision. But since you can't hang it outdoors what's the point? If you point it out a window all you get is a reflection of the night vision LEDs. I suppose some people feel the need to monitor their kids at night instead of getting up and checking on them like we have done for thousands of years. But the night vision is basically worthless.For the price and support I am sticking with Panasonic even though I still think it is a bit of money for a single security cam. But with no support and a lousy interface I can't recommend Sharx especially in that price range.

Reviews.Title: Will not work if you have an AT&T; 2701HG-B router
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, we thought we would spend the extra money on this device instead of the LTS model since we wanted to hook it up and be done with it.  Unfortunately, the product failed on step 1, connecting to our wireless network.  I could only get it to connect to my AT&T; 2wire 2701HG-B with either no wireless security enabled or with WEP.  Seeing that WEP security can be broken in a few minutes and no security is not an option, the product is useless to me.  I contacted the manufacturer and they confirmed their product will not connect to a 2wire router using WPA or WPA2 security settings.  I wish I would have known this from the beginning as it would have saved us a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: Great night vision wireless camera
Reviews.Author: C. Crocker
Reviews.Content: There are so many good things about this camera it's hard to sum up in a short review. First, the setup is straight forward...plug the camera into your router run the included software to discover the camera and you're off. If you know how to find out a device's IP address, all you really need is a web browser to configure the camera meaning it works on Linux, Mac and Windows. The wireless is stable and supports several encryption methods including WPA & WPA2. It has a built in web server so once you have it configured there is no need for a computer other than for viewing the streams. In terms of streaming, the camera has several options and can simultaneously stream 3 different signals (primary, secondary, and a mobile). The mobile stream is great if you want to view the camera using a mobile device such as an iPhone. The camera has a moonlight mode which is ideal when you have only minimal light and the infrared is great for total darkness viewing. The camera has a wide angle of view so it makes for a great nursery monitor, etc. The camera has a built-in feature which allows you to alarm on motion events and be notified either by e-mail, FTP, or HTTP. All-in-all this is a great camera and for all that you get the price is right. If you don't need night vision, then consider the SCNC2606 which offers everything the SCNC2607 does minus night vision. Check out my review on the SCNC2606...both are great cameras...you won't be disappointed with either one.

Reviews.Title: Really glad I bought this Sharx unit
Reviews.Author: RadThink
Reviews.Content: We needed a night vision (in pitch dark) camera to keep an eye on our baby who is just starting to sleep in the crib by himself and we are always concerned he likes sleeping on his side and is going to turn over on his belly (as he hasnt figured out how to turn back). While we are sleeping in the other room or downstairs it becomes quite tiring to go check on him every so often.Sharx security camera SCNC2607 to the rescue!!! Problem solved.It took me two days to research the cameras online and I narrowed it down to the Panasonic unit and the Sharx unit and all the good comments and feedback from folks who had purchased Sharx made me feel good about ordering the unit. The iPhone support was paramount for me.I first ordered it from Amazon - website said will ship in 1-3 weeks! and then after I ordered it showed "Temporarily out of stock"!!! I wasted a day on this and then ordered from another seller MJ Electronics who was selling it for $250. What a useless guy. I emailed and asked them if they can ship immediately. They responded saying they had it in stock (5 word reply). Then I placed the order and 2 days later - SAME crap - out of stock?!! SO I gave up and ordered straight from the manufacturer for $299 (same as Amazon) and used Google checkout. Voila! Camera arrived in 3 days!Manual seemed quite informative (lots of pages :-)). Some info seemed repetitive but they have tried to make it really simple. I spend about an hour on the setup and had it working perfectly with secure wireless on my Mac, PC laptop, iPhone! with AUDIO too! Its awesome. I read in some comments that audio would not work on iPhone. Not true. The free STREAMER app supports rtsp streams and does audio as well (not great - but more than sufficient for my use). Some reviews said Safari does not support audio. Again not true. I set up the camera and clicked on Primary Stream in the browser screen and it switched to quicktime plugin and I get audio in Safari too!My setup: I have a Mac (Snow Leopard), Apple Extreme router, iPhone and the camera and router are in adjacent rooms. I have tested the camera in complete darkness and it is great. With single bulb room lighting the colors are a bit off but I dont care about that.I will try opening up for intranet access tomorrow to see if my wife and my inlaws can connect from work or out of state to view our kid. Will try to update review after that. But I do not expect issues based on what I have seen.Finally, I read a lot about their great tech support - but I have not had reason to call them - thats the best kind of support - when you dont even have to call them! :-)Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Decent camera but overpriced
Reviews.Author: KM
Reviews.Content: This camera provides essentially the same quality as AirLink 101 SkyIPCam777W, but costs twice as much and does not have pan and tilt. I was happy after I bought it but needed a few more cameras and didn't want to spend a fortune. Finding SkyIPCam777W allowed me to see that such camera does not need to cost $300. Sharx may have a bit better color in the afternoon, although I haven't compared them side by side - I may do that later. At this point I would be undecided about which one to choose at the same price level, but twice the price for less features is unjustifiable.

Reviews.Title: It works (mostly) and support is there... but, how much is it worth?
Reviews.Author: John M. Petersen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera almost exclusively based on the customer rating. I have found that most of the time, the rating accurately indicates how my experience with a product will be.Unfortunately, the ratings on this product aren't really about the product itself, they are about the support and documentation.The camera is OK, really no better. Is it extremely reliable? No, I've had it crash on me. Colors - terrible - that IR cut filter from the more recent model would've been helpful. Resolution - mediocre. Framerates - again, mediocre. User Interface - meh, it's usable, but has little enhanced function.The camera was purchased so that we could watch our newborn daughter in her room, to make sure she was OK without actually getting up every few minutes. It works acceptably on ipad and android phone. The recommended app, TinyCam Monitor Free, does not support audio with this camera. Audio is supported using the mobile web interface, however, it drops the resolution down to the point of unusability.My wife liked being able to watch our youngest so much, we got another camera for our 2 year old's room. Now, at this point, I hadn't looked at the documentation nor contacted support, and, figured I'd take a gamble on a much cheaper camera, the Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - White NEWEST MODEL, which didn't have many product reviews at the time, but, appeared to be much the same, with pan and tilt, for 1/3rd the cost. This camera has BETTER video quality, with a whole bunch of features, including working audio on the same TinyCam Monitor Free Android app. This caused me to realize, 2/3rds of the cost of this product is basically for the small manual (something like 60 pages) and pedantic support which tells you to look at the manual (I did eventually contact them).Furthermore, there was a piece of paper included with the camera stating not to return it to the vendor... Seriously? Would've been nice if that was clearly stated on the product's description page. While Amazon has been great to me, I have the strong suspicion that trying to return this product would be more hassle than others.And, setup of IP cameras is pretty trivial if you know how to get IP addresses from the MAC addresses on your router (look at the dhcp lease table). I thought there would be more to this...

Reviews.Title: won't work via wifi
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: It detects the wifi connection and can be confiogured.  However,  once you disconnect the computer it doesn't work - I have spent severeral hours trying toget this to work - i give up....

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: E. Kesteloot
Reviews.Content: I'm a first-time parent and admitted geek, so please temper my comments accordingly.In the mobile's place above the crib, we mounted the Sharx camera.  It's been fantastic.  We have a computer on in the living room so we can watch him "sleep".  Basically, we hear a noise on our conventional baby monitor and our attention is drawn to the live feed from the crib.  Another nice feature is that you can go get the baby once he's awake but before he's ticked-off.  The night-vision is great.  It's a black-and-white display that captures everything from subtle movements to blinking.We've exposed the camera on the web for the grandparents.  They absolutely love it.  Both sets of grandparents are out of state, and it gives them a window into the little guy's life.  They actually bought a second camera to set up near the "Pack-n-Play".OK, some objective comments:  - At first blush set-up seems difficult, but the authors walk you through each detail (including some nice plain English definitions of industry/technical terms)  - You've seen some comments about the color picture being "pinkish".  It's due to this being the night-vision version.  The color is a little distorted, but an easy compromise given the outstanding picture in a pitch-black room.  - Technically, the camera performs well.  For fellow geeks:  I've set it up to FTP a snapshot every 15 seconds to a local server.  I have a script that runs daily to put together a time-lapse movie.  It's a great way to get an idea of how he slept.  - I was a little concerned about the lack of a technical forum on Sharx's website.  Instead you just get an email address.  Believe their bold, highlighted statement on the back of the manual "We pledge that we will not let you fail.  Contact us with any questions, no matter how simple or how complicated." - their response to emails is prompt and thoughtful (i.e., they actually read the entirety of the email and respond accordingly).  NOTE:  The issue I had was with my home network setup, not the device.  They were just as responsive as if the problem was with their equipment.  - Based on the manual's recommendation I purchased the IPVision app for my iPhone - worked like a champ.  It also streams nicely to my wife's Blackberry.By the way, I did try the "Panasonic BB-HCM511A Network Camera with Two-Way Audio".  While it allowed you to zoom, it's performance in low-light was unsuitable for my purposes.Should you decide to go with the Sharx product, I think you'll be pleased with your purchase.Should you have questions, I'll happily respond to any comments.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: E. K.
Reviews.Content: I don't often write reviews about products, but I wanted to take the time to leave a glowing review for this camera.  The other reviewers have done a great job addressing the ease of use and interface aspects of the camera.  When considering this camera, I was a bit concerned about the image quality and framerate when using the wireless connection.  On my 802.11g network, I am getting great image quality and framerates.  I would say it is very close to a wired connection, which surprised me.  The IR nightvision on the camera is also superb.  It would have been nice if they used IR LEDs that were completely out of the range of human vision (so there would be no visible red glow), but at this price point I am not disappointed.  I was on the fence about this camera simply because Sharx is not a commonly known brand name, but have been extremely impressed.

Reviews.Title: Quality, fun product
Reviews.Author: r_a_b
Reviews.Content: I wanted a "security" camera to access remotely, and this product is excellent.  I, too needed some help finding my camera image on the Web.  Sharx tech support called my landline phone after quickly answering my email query.  This was a Sunday--how is that for service?The issue I had was using a Web IP setting instead of the router's IP address; I would have eventually found the error, but tech support quickly had me up and running.  The picture quality of my "bird feeder cam" is amazing.  Even with the wide field of view and distance from the inside-behind-double-pane-glass window to the bird feeder, I could still identify a robin (yep), many sparrows and a cardinal.I am going to security-lock the camera down, but remind anybody that allows open access to pay attention to the audio settings and the various low-light choices (you may see high-quality images reflecting from your window at night).  With a few adjustments it did not take me long to eliminate my reflections.I am looking forward to seeing what my cats really do when I am not home, but may put the camera to serious use watching the weather and my house, too.  As a matter of fact, there may be another Sharx camera in my future.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera, great company, fantastic value!
Reviews.Author: Jason King
Reviews.Content: I am so happy with this camera. Yes, setting it up can be a little challenging but the company was SO helpful... they walked me through all of it. It works perfectly, the image quality is great. and I feel so much safer leaving my house unattended now. Highly recommended. I can watch video of my house from my cel!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, even better customer service
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I got the Sharx SCNC2607 for a multi use camera: baby cam, doggycam, and camera to keep an eye on the telescope when I am inside. After reading many reviews and doing research I decided on this one as the IR was supposedly excellent, I could broadcast over the internet so my husband could tune in while deployed, and although it is similar/same as other branded cams like the YCam  I heard nothing but positive about Sharx customer service. I am not disappointed on any count. Opening the package revealed a well built camera with a nice thorough manual written in English that actually makes sense and covers many typical situations for setup. Following these instructions I was easily able to get it broadcasting on the internal wireless network in our house within 5 minutes.Next I went to set it up for external broadcast and this is where I hit a snag. I could not get it to work right due to my configuration (a non-industry standard router connected to an Apple Extreme Wireless broadcaster all on a foreign network which is unreliable at best). I sent Sharx an email to the customer service email in their manual and, to my great surprise, I had a response in 15 minutes. Not only this, but they emailed back and forth troubleshooting for the next 5 and a half hours until we finally were able to get the crappy router I had to fix its PnP and DMZ to see the wireless camera outside of the local network. Let me say that this was NOT a camera problem but a problem with my router and they spent the time to not only learn a random Chinese-made router that is not widely used and badly interfaced and help me adjust its settings to work with my jerry-rigged setup. They very easily could have just said, contact your ISP who provided this POS router and ask them what settings need to be changed, but they didn't. They spent all evening and well into the morning (my time) fixing my router's settings. I have never seen a company with such excellent customer service and am rightfully impressed.Now that it is all working, my husband can tune in to us while deployed and the grandparents can check in on their granddaughter.Overall Impressions (1-10 with 10 being highest):Build of camera:......... (9) ----as mentioned in other reviews the IR lights shine red at night but otherwise everything looks solid and well builtManual: .................... (10) ----not just a one page connect this as you get this so many electronics but a through, well detailed manualPicture: ....................  (8)----Daytime looks great, as mentioned in the manual and other reviews it can have a tint of pink but that is typical with IR system without additional filters which can add to why many decent ones are very expensive-nighttime was fantastic. I could easily make out my daughters entire room with the IR sensors on and enough detail to check on her. When set to keep an eye on the telescope I used the Moonlite mode and the red lights around the scope were enough for it to work through the window well enough that I could keep an eye on its progressSound:....................... (8)----a second or two delayed from the picture but that might be my network problems. Otherwise sounds great and sensitive enough to pick up my daughter quietly talking in her bed when she woke in the middle of the night.Ease of local setup:.....(9) ----Took only 5 minutes after reading the manual instructions. You need a little knowledge of your local network (not quite plug and play but simple enough if you have a basic knowledge of your systemEase of external setup: (5)----For most systems, this is probably just as simple as the internal network, but if your router isn't set right to begin with you will have to access all of your internal router's settings which might be a daunting task for those who have never done it. I am well versed in my local network settings and interface and due to my non-typical system setup it was difficult even with the customer service's assistanceCustomer Service:.........(10+)----one of the best customer service experiences I have ever had. As mentioned in my review they took the time to fix my system settings that had nothing to do with the camera itself. Responded very quickly and spent several hours going back and forth until the problem was resolvedPrice for what you get:...(8.5)----while, yes, the camera is expensive it is much higher quality, picture, and sound than any other baby-cam I have tried. Its well-built sturdy feeling design and sleek look make it fit in just about anywhere and the web interface and the fact that you can set it to view with sound, over the internet and record videos via a motion or sound alarm or other various settings make it well worth the price.If you have this camera on your list, just go ahead and get it. You will be happy you did, I certainly am!As soon as I throw in a mini-SD card I will record some videos and post them as well in my review as soon as I can.

Reviews.Title: The best camera out there - period

Reviews.Title: Wireless failure x 2
Reviews.Author: chillwater
Reviews.Content: Have two of these and the wireless on both is now gone. Sharx replaced one when the wireless stopped working and also gave me back the old one so I can use wired. Very nice of them and they were very responsive to my emails. Saddly, the second camera wireless has now gone out. Both lasted 4 or 5 months I think. Coincidence? Just so you know, I know what I'm doing.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hardware and software (as far as I can tell).  After a break in a few weeks back, I installed this camera and added a 1 TB hard drive to my old XP machine and I now have 24/7 coverage of my boathouse and dock.  The night time pictures are great, and the software is easy to set up to your liking (you can trade off image quality to decrease the load on your network or accomodate your storage limitations).  The sensativity slider in the alarm set up page allowed me to reduce the number of false alarms.  The ability to remotely monitor the dock when I'm away from home is also neat.  I'm thinking of ordering a few more to give me complete coverage of my house as well.Update:  The XP machine gave up the ghost a few months ago, but it worked great with Vista Home Premium 64 and now Win 7 HP 64.

Reviews.Title: WOW!  Great camera, great service
Reviews.Author: gail
Reviews.Content: Wow,this is really easy to use. I had alittle trouble with the initial setup(my fault). I emailed securcam and in 5min. my cell phone rang with a tech. to help me. I wasn't near the camera at that time, so I emailed the tech at 10:00pm to let him know I was available and he called me back at 10:05pm at night. In 5 min. the problems were fixed. The camera was blocked by some metal in my roof. He tested the camera on the internet with me. I was up and running in minutes.  I purchased this camera from this company because of the great reviews. They were all true.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value, but customer service is the best part
Reviews.Author: Artemis Smythe
Reviews.Content: I've had an SCNC2607 running for about 18 months now, and it works great.  After many months of use, the external power supply (wall plug) did fail.  I contacted Sharx, who replied by email within an hour and had me mail the camera back to them.  They identified the issue and sent me back the camera with a new power supply free of charge.Customer support also helped me with some configuration issues over email when I first set it up.  It's rare to experience this kind of customer service in this day and age!  Sharx may be an unfamiliar name, but I'm a fan.I also noticed they continue to add new features and refinements via firmware updates.  Nice.

Reviews.Title: Good support
Reviews.Author: M.Holle
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 2607 model over the weekend, received it on Tuesday and had it on my local network within 20 minutes. Then I spent the next several evenings trying to get it up on the internet. If you're not a techie, this can be frustrating. I had no idea about ports, static vs dynamic ip's, or intranet vs internet until i began this project. The manual by itself is worth a read just to better understand your network.I had an older 2wire router that doesn't support UNpN - things got tough until i scanned to the very back and found my answer on appendix B. Assigning a static ip baffled me - chosing a compatible local ip range must use the first three GROUPS of numbers on your net, i mis read this as retaining only the first three numbers. The point is slow down and read carfully. When i finally gave up and emailed tech support, they responded within minutes - got home that evening and had everything running on the internet using no-ip as a host.Very good camera, decent picture although my next one will be the xx06 model to avoid the color washout with the infrared units. Excellent tech support and a well written manual. Definetely reccomend sharx products...Do not use the website contact, they don't respond to the inquiry, rather just send an email to info at sharx security dot com.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Joseph S. Barnes
Reviews.Content: First let me say the reason for all the high marks on this product is not just because it worked exactly as advertised but when I was having difficulty with getting everything to work Sharx Tech Support was the most professional and Quick to respond that I have ever dealt with. Now on to the Review and how I used this device and got it up and working.I am part of a small organization that basically wanted to monitor a single room that is closed off from the rest of the area. Any closed circuit or dedicated system we were looking at were very cost prohibitive. We managed to use a couple of devices to make somewhat closed circuit system of our own. We took the Lacie Wireless space with its built in NAS and this Wireless Security camera Since this Camera can record directly to Network Attached storage it made for a very low cost, small footprint solution to our issue. The camera covers almost the entire room about an 18X15X8 room. We had some trouble configuring the device to record to the NAS, but after a quick trouble shooting session with Sharx (the tech support treated me like a person and not a script) it was determined that their device was working exactly as expected. After a much longer trouble shooting session with Lacie they came to the same conclusion as Sharx and I did and that was the device was bad. They quickly replaced it and when this one was set up everything work perfectly. The Camera connects and records to the WirelessSpace no problem and it is separated from any other network so only people with access to the wireless signal can get to the camera. Its a great little system and comes in for less that 500 for the whole setup. Considering every other system we looked at was in the thousands of dollars range I would say this is a Great solution for our needs and just might be the solution for you. Its worth looking at for the price you can't beat this quality.

Reviews.Title: Best Pet Cam!
Reviews.Content: Love Love Love this product! works really well and relatively easy to set up. Picture clarity is excellent! I'm buying another!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Chris Harnish
Reviews.Content: In setting the camera up, we had an issue with an overly complex AT&T; modem/router. The Sharx tech, Ray, worked with me and then with me and the AT&T; tech until we got it right. I felt totally taken taken care of. Their statement on the back of the user guide is 100% true: "We pledge that we will not let you fail."The user guide gave particularly detailed and easy to follow instructions for setting it up with an Apple Airport wireless router, which is rare for user guides.

Reviews.Title: Get this Network Cam!
Reviews.Author: Scott E. Russell
Reviews.Content: I've been looking at wireless network cameras for added security in my house. I first bought a Panasonic BL-C131A network camera and had nothing but problems with it's wireless performance and accessibility from outside my home network ([...]). After struggling with the Panasonic for a week I decided to return it to Amazon, which if you've never returned an item, it was easy as pie.After I did the return I noticed the Sharx network camera, in particular the SCNC2607. I was a bit hesitant on purchasing the Sharx camera since I had such a bad experience with the Panasonic. But after my return was accepted I ordered the Sharx.The camera was delivered yesterday and after getting it unboxed and connected, it was setup in a matter of minutes. Of course there are setting such as the motion detection settings that need to be tweaked but all in all the setup was a breeze and only took a short time.What is nice about this camera is that it does not require a Windows computer with its software to do the initial setup. Once the camera is connected to the wired LAN it can be setup all from within a web browser.I have an Apple Time Capsule router with Comcast high speed internet and have no problems at all setting up the camera and accessing it from outside my home. Another nice feature is that the camera has a built in dynamic DNS client that can be used to setup external access to your camera. I use DynDNS and it's fully compatible.I also had a few questions for Sharx and if you email their info email someone will answer very quickly to help. Along with a great user manual there should be not problems in setup and support.I know this camera is a bit more than others like the Panasonic but it is well worth it. It has a great picture and is easy to setup. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: Price worthy product
Reviews.Author: Joe.V
Reviews.Content: Purchased the SCNC2607 since I wanted to see my newborn while away on duty. Didn't expect much, mostly since I was not familiar with the brand name and that it's pretty cheap compared to similar products. I picked this particular camera (in a hurry) thanks to the positive reviews on Amazon.What I needed was 1. Clear video 2. Mpeg-4 (for smooth stream) 3. Wireless 4. night vision. After having it running for two moths I must admit that I am amazed on the quality of this product.I work for a large organisation where we currently work with top brands like Axis 221 and 233D, Panasonic I pro. The other day we were comparing my Sharx with Axis 221, a camera that is 4-5 times more expensive and the Sharx totally owed, both on the quality of the stream, nigh vision and triggers.I had to contact customer support once since I had a issue with delivering the product outside the states and can confirm that they are extremely customer friendly and professional as stated in multiple reviews.I would really like them to construct this camera in a pan/tilt/zoom version preferably with both mpeg-4 and H.264 compression.I can totally recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Powerful, feature rich camera, AND great picture!
Reviews.Author: George Whittam
Reviews.Content: HIGHLY recommended!There are many interesting products coming out of China, but support is a major concern.  After extensive research my client and I decided on the Sharx cameras.  We were a little skeptical because of the unfamiliar brand name, but the few reviews on here helped us make purchase.  Not only are there no other cameras that I am aware of that can do everything this one can (WIFI, night vision, access from cell phone), but it actually DOES everything advertised.Best of all their support is top notch, which is crucial with a product so complex.  Even the user manual, although brief, is very clearly written and helpful for even the less experienced user.  Still, I wouldn't expect someone who's never setup a router to dive into it without some additional guidance from the manufacturer.The color image is great, but might have a magenta (pinkish) tint when shooting indoors with incandescent lights because the CCD sensor does not have an infrared filter on it, which any ordinary digital camera must have to generate accurate color.  The lack of filter allows the camera to pickup IR images in total darkness, illuminated by its built-in IR illumination.  They even kick on automatically when needed, a setting that is configurable.  In fact EVERYTHING is configurable on these cameras.  They even stream multiple formats simultaneously.If you are Mac user you might need to contact Sharx about how to properly view the video stream with audio, but it is very easy once you understand how it works.  My client was psyched when he could watch from his iPhone while at work and keep an eye on his sick dog.Now we just need a waterproof housing to mount it outside the house, and we'll be all set!You can get one from SecurCam, just search the web for them.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: ER
Reviews.Content: I bought Sharx SCNC2606, and Sharx SCNC2607, and SCNC2607W over six months ago. This review is for all of them. The cameras work as advertised and I can describe them all as AMAZING products. I'm not a tech savvy, but I followed the well written manual until I got them all working without a hitch, utilizing almost every single feature including saving to a NAS drive. Their incredible customer service is a different story. I had issues at first saving to my NAS drive, because of the way I set up my NAS, not because of the cameras, but Sharx customer service walked me through the NAS set up and the problems were solved. Never told me contact the NAS drive manufacturer. You can sense how well driven they are to make the Sharx products successful.

Reviews.Title: Performs as advertised
Reviews.Author: Catalin Goilav
Reviews.Content: After receiving the camera, setting it up was almost a breeze. My only comment on the installation and configuration is that for me it was not very clear immediately if the camera needs to be unplugged or not from the network cable to test the wi-fi. I found it in the manual eventually, but after some trial and errors.The manual is quite comprehensive, although a bit non professional.The quality of the image is not very good (lack of sharpness and purple tint). I give Sharx credit for mentioning the tinting in the manual, however that is not an excuse. Regardless of infrared or not, the camera should be able to switch from purple tint to super clear and correct colors when there's enough light. I get purple tint even in normal day light which is not ok.Other than that, I find the fact that I can move the camera any time from one location to another super convenient. I only need a power outlet and that's that. Give it power and it's back up and running.They should have included a clamp for mounting the camera on cribs, desks and other indoor ledges. I was pretty dissapointed with the mounting system which only allows screws.Overall it's a good camera for mediocre expectations which was also my case. I use it for baby monitoring where I need to catch movement and noise bot not extreme detail.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. OHalligan
Reviews.Content: No a bad unit for the money. Easy to set up and the video quality is great on your home computer or laptop. I use this as a baby monitor and to see my son while I'm at work and missing him. I'm thinking of adding a few more for security cams at home also.  I can use it on my iPhone (the reason I got it) but the video is chopy. On my iPhone it looks as though the video is about 10 frames per second and I cannot get it to stream in 3G mode. Over all a good camera. I did a lot of research and and mostly happy with the camera. If I could watch full motion video with my iPhone I would give the camera 5stars.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: pulmd
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to use as a baby monitor.  I priced a number of other similar camera systems out and this is definitely the best value for this type of item.  It does take some network setup knowledge, as it's not the simplest thing in the world to set up, but the customer service on this is the most responsive and best of any kind of electronics company out there.  I only wish we could get it to send pictures to my Blackberry.  It sends stuff to the iPhone just fine and the internet web access is easy to use.  I know this is asking a lot, but I wish it had a panning function too and I realize that would add quite a bit of complication to the technology.  Its lens is sufficiently wide angle enough to catch most of the baby's room when we mounted it high in a corner.

Reviews.Title: BEST BABY MONITOR EVER!
Reviews.Author: Deb A. Longua
Reviews.Content: As a new mom, I was looking for a baby monitor that would provide a large, clear view of my baby, while keeping minimal equipment on hand.  Since I have a computer (MacBook Pro), I figured there must be a way to see my baby on my computer.  I found Sharx Security Cameras and contacted them to see if they had a product that could hook up to my laptop wirelessly. They had just launched the VIPcella Camera #SCNC2607 with infrared. I ordered it immediately, and have been EXTREMELY impressed with the camera's VERY clear view in daylight (with color), and it's EXCEPTIONAL night vision capabilities! What's even cooler is the fact that I can also pull up the view on my iPhone, and my husband can log in and view from his PC at work!  And we can record it if we need to!  This is such a brilliant idea, because it's close in price to a typical baby monitor with video, yet it's clean, simple, and we can use it later for a security camera for our home!  Additionally, I was equally impressed with Sharx customer service and technical support who enabled me to get my new camera up and running!  I am not very techy, so it was important for me to have someone walk me through the process! GREAT-EASY-COMPACT-AWESOME!!!  Deb

Reviews.Title: Very close to perfect, but not quite
Reviews.Author: Tim N
Reviews.Content: (Review updated in August 2012, moved to 5 stars, updated comments.)This product is more expensive than others on the market, and it seems this is because of the Infrared capabilities. This is well worth it.Initial reactions for the product are quite positive. The setup instructions are written very well, including directions on setting up no-ip.org or other methods of streaming. These directions are quite literally step-by-step in some cases, telling you exactly what is on the screen and what to click. This is well done. Also, the product itself seems to work as designed, wirelessly streaming data, and sending emails or other alerts as configured.I'm updating my review from a 4-star review to five-star review. My only outstanding gripe:- Browser support. I use Chrome, and not all configuration features are available. In fact, I didn't even know about four or five key features until I tested this on IE. This is quite shocking; why would a web-based configuration tool not be written to comply with browser standards? Note that streaming seems to work on any browser type.Previously when I left my four-star review, I was unaware of the IP Camera app for Android. This app is not developed by Sharx, but it allows me to view the streaming video. Frankly I don't see a need for Sharx to waste development time making something in-house if it already exists and works with their product.The main reason I'm upgrading this from 4 to 5 stars is Sharx support. I had some glitch on my router that made the streaming part of the camera stop working. Sharx called me and we worked it out. It was some of the best support I've ever had. The support is US-based, and clearly these are people who understand the inner-workings of the product (and even of their customers' routers), and they aren't off-shore drones just blindly reading a script.

Reviews.Title: A great buy I am very happy
Reviews.Author: Tuco "dindy_g"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras last year after several "incidents" outside my townhome.  I got tired of sitting in the window watching and realistically I could not be there all the time.  So far this camera has helped me to catch who was letting their dog run loose and crap all over my sidewalk.  The other day it helped me to know which kid was using my yard for bike stunts.  I am very happy with the results of this camera and am getting one for my backyard.  I have this sitting in my front window and it is angled so I can see my entire front lawn including my cars parked in the front.  I work in IT but I still needed to check the set up guide for some things but it was really easy to get up and running on my home network.  I keep memory cards in it at all times but I enjoy being able to pull it up fron anywhere on the web to see what is happening at the house while I am at work.  It works OK at night if I leave my 100 watt front lantern on.  I do not use the IR feature because it would just reflect back onto itself from the window glass and I do not want to freak people out who walk by thinking I am some kind of weirdo filming them.  I only really check the footage when I see something amiss.  Make sure you have it set to save "thumbnail" photos as it makes it easier to pin point what time frame to check when you have to review like 8-10 hours of footage.  It is a shame you cannot trust people to do the right thing and respect your property anymore but this camera has really given me peace of mind knowing that when I see something damaged or changed at my house I can find out who did it.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for baby monitor
Reviews.Author: throwback1986
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to setup and use.  The audio quality greatly exceeds other cameras (looking at you Foscam!) and the picture quality can be configure to be as good as your network will support.  I use the Baby Monitor HD app on the iPhone and two Sharxcams to keep an eye on the little guy.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Bobo
Reviews.Content: I got two of these plus half of dozen Panasonic BL series cams.  Yes, I know it would be cheaper to get one of those Swann camera set.  But I really like where this does not require a unit like a server to host all my video stuff.  I got both units mounted outside the house.  One in the front and another in the back.  Both are outdoors and screwed in under the gutters.  I have night vision enabled.  It is not the greatest night version but compare with other brands, I'm very happy with the quality.  A little clearer would be nice but for the price I paid, I will good.Mobile - I used an app called "IP Cam Viewer".  Both Android and IOS versions are available.  This app has a feature where you can see all your cams on one screen.Setup couldn't be easier.  Enter a static IP, the camera is done.  Externally, I open a specific port per camera.  So for camera 1, I have port 8081, camera 2, 8082, etc.  I like ports so I can block them remotely quickly.  Also, I installed a small client from Dyn DNS client.  It runs on any of your machines internally (firewall) and update Dyn your public IP so you can access your camera(s) from the Internet using DNS name.  In my case, it would be something like [...]For the Panasonics, I was able to mount the entire thing wirelessly.  Meaning, I have a camera connected to a battery pack, and the battery pack to a solar panel.  I have all these screw on top of my tree.  So I don't have have to run power or ethernet.  One thing is Winter time, the battery may not charge so there are times where I don't have camera power.  I couldn't get this unit to work in that configuration.  Panasonic works, don't know why.In addition, I set each camera to upload to my  Godaddy page.  If you purchase a domain name, you get like a 1-3 web page free.  You really don't need a web page, just set your cameras to ftp the photos to your domain name at GoDaddy.  I UPS everything, except the on up on the tree.

Reviews.Title: Great camera.  Horrible mount
Reviews.Author: S. Griffiths "judgement"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It was easy to setup. Takes great video.However, here are my complaints:1)  The images are over exposed when in with the IR Illumination on.2)  The mount that the camera comes with is horribly designed.  Almost useless.  The camera flops all over the place and it is very difficult to tighten the mount enough to keep it straight.  It also is hard to point the camera in very many orientations.  The mount is overly complex and I needs to be completely redesigned.3) The power supply should employ a right angle connector so that it doesn't get in the way of the mount, allowing for greater range of motion.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product Combined With Great Service
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Wallace
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent. Compact size, superb picture, and overall great functionality. Most importantly, these guys provide the best level of technical assistance I have ever experienced.  I am a novice setting up wireless networks, and the Sharx team was there at every step helping me get  the camera connected to the network. They were friendly, helpful, and, instantly responsive , real time. And I loved therir instruction manual. It is written in "real English", not a cobbled translation from a technical manual. I would recommend the Sharx team to anyone, anytime. I wish more tech companies understood and practiced the service model Sharx  uses.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: YK
Reviews.Content: Bought this about a year ago. Have been very satisfied.The installation while not trivial is very well documented in the manual. The manual deserves a special mention as I think it is the one best, most detailed guides to installation that I have seen.The product works very well. We can clearly see what's going on at night time using the night vision mode. The picture is pretty sharp and the colors are pretty good.The most important thing is the ability to access the camera over internet.I have tried several browsers (IE, Chrome, Firefox) as well as Safari on mac and iphone and it worked on all of them although I could only get sound on IE using the Active-X plugin from Sharpx.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but I sent it back
Reviews.Author: Gregory S Williamson
Reviews.Content: I like this camera but I could not stream the video to my iPad2 with audio. This is not a problem with the camera, I just could not find a player for the iPad that can play password-protected MPEG4 streams. I could view the JPEG stream, which has no audio, and the picture was fine, the infrared is great for viewing a dark room, although I did have to refresh the browser once to reconnect to the stream -- the image was frozen. I was using this for a baby monitor and the screen deceptively showed a frozen image of the baby sleeping. The stream connection issue is probably not an issue with the camera -- more likely it was a problem with the network or the browser. In any case, my hope to stream video from the baby's room to my iPad2 was dashed. Maybe a better McGuyver could get it to work, but I thought it would be easier to send this camera back and buy a video baby monitor.I did try streaming the MPEG4 stream with audio wirelessly to my Windows laptop (with IE/ActiveX), and it worked fine although the web page layout was wonky, with the video overlapping some of the controls on the page.If I needed a security camera to catch the neighbors dog messing on my lawn, or see who was stealing my newspaper off the front stoop, or see what was eating the tomatoes out of the garden, I would buy this camera again. I just don't need that at present.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: 2 year Customer - outstanding product
Reviews.Content: As you see in the title I am using the cameras for 2 years. Shortly after I got the first camera I was so impressed that I got a second one since I had add. areas to monitor.My overall rating is 5 stars with no exception and I am using a lot of the cameras features: wireless and wired network connection, SD disk and Network Attached Storage (NAS-Drive), remote monitoring from work PC, Android and IPhone, motion detection, different levels of user security, different streaming configs., Night Vision, different alarm schedules, email notification, cont. recording, snapshot on alarm, video on alarm.If you monitor your baby/child over your phone while you are at friends house, etc. or if you have to monitor a property of yours that is unattended for a long period (get an email notification on an event and check your camera for the recording triggered the email) - the cameras cover a large spectrum of surveillance needs.A view words about the company and the customer service:Sharx customer service is a good as the camera - 5 STARS. You normally wouldn't need them because the camera sets itself up automatically - but lets be honest - we all are special, have special need, our network setup might be improper, or the situation we want the camera to use for might be special and you haven't figured out how to configure the camera to meet your needs (because you are new to the subject) === The company is there for you ===One weekend my router failed and I noticed it by using the camera. I thought it was the camera and contacted Sharx. They exchanged a few emails with me and help me understand my issue (the router) and got me back running during the same weekend!!!Bottom line: I did a lot of research, had different products from different companies, after I found Sharx my needs are met and I would by another cam from them in a heart beat if I have the need for it!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera from a Great Company!
Reviews.Author: DMA
Reviews.Content: I received this camera over a year ago as a gift and I couldn't be happier with it.  It is both easy to install and use, and the video quality is wonderful. To be able to be on the other side of the country and login to see what is going on in your home is comforting, having it work correctly is priceless.  If you ever have questions or need help, SharxSecurity responds to your emails in a matter of minutes and get any problems resolved.  I would highly recommend them to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great instructions
Reviews.Author: BenRen "brendanr0011"
Reviews.Content: Seems like a bunch of these cameras are very similar.. attach to wired network, set up for wireless, switch to wireless, configure dynamic DNS for access anywhere, set up email alerts, etc.  The winning aspect of this camera was a set of very precise instructions that I could follow without a hitch, for OSX and a Time Capsule.  Got it all working within an hour or so, and didn't need to use the promised tech support, but appreciated the fact that it's offered.

Reviews.Title: Great little cam
Reviews.Author: Rick Scott
Reviews.Content: This IP Cam does what it says! Simple to set up, easy to view online, on my iPhone and iPad. I bought the iOS IP Cam Viewer app, $2.99 and it works great on both iPhone and iPad. Now when I have a motion detector go off at home I can view from anywhere in the world. Great stuff!

Reviews.Title: Sharx Security - Firmware V4.21
Reviews.Author: James M. Martin "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Does anyone have a phone number for Sharx Security?  I need the latest firmware release and can't figure out how to get in contact with them.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera and Manual
Reviews.Author: Appreciates Quality "G"
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing product.  Takes some time to setup as it does everything you need.  The manual is great and there email support was patient and very helpful.  Tried a Cisco camera first, no manual, install disk did not see my network.  Tried it on two computers.  Gave up and bought this.  You do have to understand your settings but the manual explains them step by step.  They also have an outdoor camera.  This is sold on the sharkxsecurity website.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera with an Excellent Manual
Reviews.Author: David Burkhart
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. The manual is possibly the best written manual for a technical product that I have ever encountered. It is written in clear language, and anticipates many of the confusions people may have. Make no mistake--this isn't completely plug-and-play (not network device like this is), and if you are completely unfamiliar with networks, you should read the manual carefully. I had one question I wasn't certain about, so I e-mailed their support, and got an excellent answer very quickly (and, yes, had I read the manual more carefully I would have seen the answer).The camera has great picture quality, and the night feature is great. I'm glad I didn't go with a cheaper option.

Reviews.Title: Works well - as expected based on reviews here
Reviews.Author: Karl Fronk "gadget man"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. Easy to set up. This may seem like a minor detail, but even this expert had to repeatedly reference the well written manual to get it set up correctly. Can record video within camera on microSD card. Sends emails on motion detection which is nice. Can watch live video on cell phone. Has been connected since the day it was set up - no issues reconnecting when power fluctuations knocked out internet.

Reviews.Title: The best stand alone web network camera for the iPhone and iPad
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am not a network person so I was greatly pleased at how easy this was to set up.  This security camera helps monitor our vacation home.  It has been running 24/7 since December with no glitches which is almost unbelievable in the computer world.  One of the best things about this video security camera is that it is easy to access from the iPhone and the iPad.  We even had a situation where we were worried that the caretaker's cat had snuck back in minutes before the house was closed down for the summer.  We were able to verify with the camera's help that the cat was not inside because we could see the cat on the back porch looking in through the sliding glass doors (whew!)The manual is excellent.  I am now considering a multi-view setup with additional Sharx cameras.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Application - Great Customer Support.
Reviews.Author: DV_User "DV_User"
Reviews.Content: The Camera delivers exactly as advertised. You pay a premium price for a premium product.I had some problems to view the Camera online from a remote location because of some home networking complications. The Customer Support was highly qualified and very responsive. They provided me with detailed technical but yet simple instructions on how to make the Camera work within my home network (AT&T; Router, Wireless router and VOIP Phone adaptor). After a couple of emails everything worked exactly as advertised.Thanks!A Very Happy Customer.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Support
Reviews.Author: b-rock
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after buying and returning the Sharx 6206 model, as the moonlight mode on the 6206 did not see well enough in low light to serve as a suitable baby monitor.  The night vision mode on the 6207 is great and overall I would recommend any of the Sharx cameras.The camera comes with a detailed instruction book, written in plain English, that walks you through every step of the setup.  I did have a few complications as my new setup on my router was conflicting with the previously established configuration.  I sent several questions to Sharx support and got quick responses every time, helping me to establish connectivity with the camera over the internet and configure DDNS.My only complaint is being unable to hear the sound from the broadcast on my iPhone, but I understand that to be an iPhone issue rather than something with the Sharx camera.Bottom line, this is a great product and definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: worth it
Reviews.Author: the dude "Festivus"
Reviews.Content: I had some difficulty setting up the camera, but this is mostly my fault because I have 2 routers.  However:  I contacted them for help via email on Sunday and they responded within 30 minutes.  They responded after 3 more queries in a timely fashion and helped me each time.  I am now able to view the camera over my wireless network and on my blackberry.  The picture is amazing and the IR nightvision is quite remarkable.  I don't have any experience with the other manufacturers mentioned by other reviewers, but if you're afraid that this company doesn't stand behind its product - don't be.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, Outstanding Support
Reviews.Author: Geraldo V.
Reviews.Content: 1. Supports iPhone/iPod Touch Safari browser.2. Supports RTSP streams to Blackberry Media Player/Web Browser3. Support by email is very fast.  A sound issue found in the evening was acknowledged and fixed via email/remote firmware update in less than 10 minutes.4. Overall, the camera works rather well.I highly recommend this camera and Sharx to anyone interested in netcam technology.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Service
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these cameras a month ago for security.  I had tried two different cameras before buying these.  The other two cameras would not work with my AT&T; e-mail, which like gmail requires SSL to connect and send mail.  This camera works well and was very easy to set up with its universal plug and play (upnp).  The cameras automatically set up my wireless router's port forwarding.  I have a DSL router in front of my wireless router, so Sharx helped me set up port forwarding in the DSL router.  This was not difficult.  Sharx helped via e-mail and offered to set up a telephone appointment which I did not need.The Sharx technical support is the best technical support I have come across in years.I highly recommend this camera.  I think these would make great gifts for families with young children and for people who enjoy technology.  The camera met all my expectations, which were high after trying two others.Thanks to Sharx for this product and their service.

Reviews.Title: execellent security camera
Reviews.Author: Roby Hartono
Reviews.Content: everything is very good on this security camera....especially if you need extra feature during the night time where there is no light on the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: superior customer service
Reviews.Author: Ellie
Reviews.Content: Fun camera to have, We got it for security reasons, but are enjoying watching the nightlife around here.  seeing much more than we expected. Footage is very clear.  If I could give 10 stars for customer service, I would,  I'd never set up wireless anything, and was nervous about getting the new wireless router connected as well as the sharx camera.  felt I was in over my head.  The sharx customer service was exceptional. I ran into something I did not know early on in the process, Sharx sent me handout, pictures  explaining the process and then called to walk me through the process, and continued to walk me through the rest of the setup. I am new to video taping and they have answered all me newbie questions with true help and patience, even on things not directly related to their camera.  A real pleasure to work with. Highly recommend this company.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: David Feeney
Reviews.Content: I consulted with a security company about installing security cameras for our home - the quote I got back was $1400 for two cameras and a DVR.  I decided instead to try this solution as the price was better and the reviews were generally good.  Overall I am pleased with this product; it performs as advertised and the support is very good (albeit via email).  The one thing I would warn others about it the night vision does not work well when the camera is looking out of a window.  The IR light reflects back on the camera and the image is poor.  The 'Moonlight' setting works well to compensate for this, especially if you have at least a little light outside at night, say from a streetlight or neighbor's house.So, if I had known this I would have saved a few bucks and bought the regular model without the night vision.  Also, the colors with this model are off due to the requirements of being able to see in the dark, which I don't do, so that's kind of a bummer, too.  If you have the need to see in complete darkness, inside, then this is the one for you.  If there is some ambient light and/or you are pointing it out a window I would suggest the SCNC2606.

Reviews.Title: Sharx VIPcella SCNC2607 Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Herman
Reviews.Content: Not knowing anything about security cameras, I purchased the Sharx camera based on various reviews I read in different websites. I tried it for a week and it might be okay for some people, but it did not work well for me. I adjusted the position of the camera, I adjusted the infrared on the camera, but nothing seemed to improve the night picture. The people at Sharx are fairly prompt at responding to inquiries for help. The short of it: Needless to say, Amazon was gracious in allowing me to return the camera.

Reviews.Title: don't waste your time with anything else
Reviews.Author: Rowol
Reviews.Content: I researched this product for a lot longer than I would like to admit.  I finally bought both the day and night capable versions 2606 and 2607 models and could not be happier.  Set up was a breeze.  I had one quick question and Sharx support could not be more helpful.  In fact, they didn't rush me off the phone like other companies and actually showed me other features of the camera that I didn't even know existed.  I use the night cam to monitor my little boy.  It has never failed in complete darkness.  Perfect when I'm on the road and want to check him out on my iPhone.  Simply awesome.  Between picture quality and ease of use, it's a no brainer.  Stay away from the PC only cams.  This works on my Macs and PCs as well as multiple phones.  Simply amazing!  For once, a product that not only does what it says, but does it better!

Reviews.Title: Good cameras!
Reviews.Author: Darla
Reviews.Content: Love our new cameras.  Excellent customer service at Sharx too.  Straight forward set up and your security camera is on the job.

Reviews.Title: Best IP Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Kalarakis
Reviews.Content: Setup the camera took less than 5 minutes. Day and night mode excellent. Microphone works good. Planning to get 2 more.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Joe Long
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The image quality is excellent!  It took me about ten minutes from the time I open the box, read the manual for the first few pages, and voila, it is working beautifully.For sure, I will buy a couple more for my house security.  The best product!

Reviews.Title: Not better than any $50 camera
Reviews.Author: Amiram Saban "amiram2000"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this product based on high average rating and company's commitment that they "will not let you fail". The high price make me believe that this is a good reliable product. Boy was I wrong.  Sharx first response arrived after 4 days by e-mail  (I could not find a phone number). Their 2nd response came after 10 days, and their 3rd response have never made it.  This product is no better than any $50 cameras. Do not worry about risking $300 on a bad product. Do worry about spending 30 hours trying to make it work. If you have free time, then this is the right camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Customer service was outstanding.
Reviews.Author: M. Williams
Reviews.Content: First the good news: This camera did everything it said it would.  I was able to set it up on the internet for use with my iPhone and web browser at work.  Great!  I was really pleased.  The manual was very thorough and easy to read and follow.Now for the bad news: I bought this camera in August of 2009 and used it continuously for a month.  After that, it was no longer needed and put away. I took it out last month to set it up again and it will not power up.  I have tried different sockets and checked the wires but nothing.  I have contacted the company for a replacement and  I am waiting to hear from them.I will report back when I hear from them.7/30/10Update:  Customer service was outstanding.  I explained my problem in an email and after a few attempts at troubleshooting, they asked me to return the unit citing that it was a problem with the adapter.  I now have a new unit.  I am very pleased with the outcome.  However, I will not let it sit in a closet ever again.

Reviews.Title: Quality product
Reviews.Author: Mike S.
Reviews.Content: I have the camera installed outside in a plastic ycam weatherproof case (~$125 from the US distributor). Wireless ran okay for a while. I had to run an ethernet cable due to the number of wireless signals in my area. Living objects are pink / purple. The camera's focus is excellent. The daytime picture is very clear. Nighttime video, with IR on, has a lot of motion blur and cloudiness. Bugs love the IR. IR illuminators are available from other sources. I may buy another one of these cameras or a ycam (same thing) in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: V. Dutka
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to set up (assuming you are familiar with setting up network stuff) and the quality of the images is great. It works very well in all light levels, the images are sharp/clear and works on a Mac/iPhone. I just wish that you can hear sounds via a Mac (it only works with PC's using ActiveX controls).

Reviews.Title: Who are the 5 star review?
Reviews.Author: Pac Lay
Reviews.Content: How can this product get so many 5 star?This camera have the same feature set as other camera cost 1/3 but does have a better picture at low light.  Took me hours just to get wifi working.  I have the Trendnet 110W and took me less than 30 mins to setup.Pro:Good picture in low lighting.Good Motion detection(only in good lighting condition)easy setup if you just want to view the feed with network cable.Con:when setup email and fty alarm, can't test whether it is working.Wifi is vary picky(certain channel, only 8 character passkey for wpa3#FTP not working#still waiting for tech support)

Reviews.Title: frustrating support
Reviews.Author: ben
Reviews.Content: camera setup took several hours, and that was with support on the phone.  After it was set up, everything worked great.  Except that to record using their software, multi-live, it has to be open and the computer has to be running in order to receive videos.  This is not explained in the manual.  This was very frustrating for me because I couldn't understand why I wasn't receiving surveillance videos.for people who live busy lives, tech support leaves a lot to be desired.  They prefer to support you via emai.  However, even then they selectively answered my questions...I asked the same question about 4 times, in separate emails over a period of two weeks (they don't always respond immediately).  I got one person to agree to talk to me on the phone to set up one camera initially; the next time I tried to speak with someone I missed the scheduled phone appointment (you can't just call in, they don't answer the phone). I have not been able to get a tech on the phone in the last 4 weeks.  Since they prefer to use email, it can take weeks to get issues resolved, at least it has been this long for me.  I've actually been begging to have a phone conversation with tech support, humiliating really.For those who think like a techie, setting these cameras up might not be a serious challenge.  If you don't and you're a busy person, this might prove to be a frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work through window at night
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: Dont purchase if you are hoping to monitor through a window at night, all you see is bounce back lighting against window coming from camera. Connection problems and not easy to use.Otherwise the image quality is decent, but I could never get it to stay connected and use iPhone for monitoring.

Reviews.Title: can't say enuthing but great camara
Reviews.Author: Dr. Harold Osborne "hw"
Reviews.Content: these cameras are the greatest and there tec. support is better then anything i have ever used you will just love what they can doo a lot better then wilife they stink had 6 of them and lost  5 of them afer 1 year don't buy wilife

Reviews.Title: Great customer service from Sharx!
Reviews.Author: VHX2195
Reviews.Content: It took me about ten-fifteen minutes of total work to set up this camera, and I had one minor problem (which was my fault for not reading the manual closely enough)--Sharx customer service emailed me back with the solution within a couple hours.  With so many products these days you cannot hope for a response within weeks, if at all, so to get help so quickly is really super customer service.  Before this I had the Panasonic camera, and the video quality of the Sharx is definitely superior, although the Panasonic has a longer wireless range.  And of course the Panasonic is useless at night, versus the night vision of the Sharx!

Reviews.Title: So-so camera
Reviews.Author: nicubunu
Reviews.Content: From a technical point of view the camera  is so-so, the part I was unhappy the most is the support: on the manufacturer website you won't find any "support" section with FAQs, help or documentation. The only thing you can do is to send an inquiry from a very simplistic web form and wait to be called back, during the work days and when they are not in the filed, at a customer site. Which does not work well when you are in a different time zone. In the end, the support  engineers will give some generic answers and will offer to connect remotely and configure the camera for you, black magic, without you knowing what happened.Back to the technical side: the image quality is OK (not great), the camera works OK with Firefox, lacking only a few additional and little useful features present only in Internet Explorer. A problem for me was the camera work in wireless mode only then the LAN cable is disconnected, so you have to make the initial settings with a LAN connection and hope for the best when switching to wireless.

Reviews.Title: I love this company and their products
Reviews.Author: Gail Olbrich
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It does everything that was advertised.  It was fairly easy to setup, but I did have a couple questions along the way, mostly due to my router being very old.  I went online to the Sharx website, filled out their contact form, and was contacted via email (my preferred method) right away.  Their help was wonderful.  Clear, simple, polite, precise. I wish I could think of more adjectives.  I will buy from them exclusively in the future.  I have never had a more pleasant experience with tech support on any product at any time.

Reviews.Title: Worthless
Reviews.Author: D. Gordon
Reviews.Content: I received this product today about 5 hours ago. I have read the manual and attempted to follow it to a T. I have had to reset the item twice because when I followed the instructions the item became invisible to my computer. For 300 dollars this product should have been very simple. Instead I find out the only way to contact support is through email. The only way to look onto this product from another computer or a cell phone is by signing up with a website and hope you get a free IP address. I am extremely frustrated with this and realize that this is a waste of time and money.
